column4: I just did an update and it apparently messed up my X server and graphics stuff. I barely made it to graphical display after restarting. Now my system tells me I don't appear to be using the NVIDIA X driver. I ran nvidia-xconfig, as the message said I should, but nothing changed. I still haven't got my window title bars. any thoughts?
uninstall the old restricted drivers and install them again (you will be installing a newer version)
how do I uninstall it, though? It says I don't have them. the update messed up something major
can I just activate the recommended version from "hardware drivers"? It actually tells me that I have a different version of it in use.
ok, but I messed it up once already by doing it... I'll try restarting
you could remove it using synaptic...
it will be nvidia-177-*something* or something like that...
but I already activated it now. would that be a problem?
oh... you managed to activate it... just restart than
no luck. Upon restart it tried starting gdm a few times and failed, then started it up in low graphics mode
now I'm back to generic settings. the display itself is almost fine, it's just that it doesn't show window frames, titlebars and task panes
um... just remove all nvidia releated stuff than... so than you can start fresh... "--purge" also might help a bit
would you be so kind to type the entire command? I'm quite the noob at troubleshooting. thanks a bunch
after the purge, should I just restart or... hm, it doesnt show ANYTHING in hardware drivers now. should I update apt-get?
